meanings.definition: To deceive or cheat someone out of money or possessions.
meanings.sent1: She scammed her friend by pretending to sell a rare book.
meanings.sent2: The con artist scammed unsuspecting victims out of their life savings.
meanings.sent3: The magician scammed the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The scammer scammed the old lady out of her retirement fund.
meanings.sent5: The online scammer scammed people by promising fake prizes.

meanings.definition: To obtain money or goods by fraudulent means.
meanings.sent1: He scammed his way into getting free concert tickets.
meanings.sent2: The fake charity scammed people into donating for a non-existent cause.
meanings.sent3: The cat scammed the dog out of its treats by pretending to be hungry.
meanings.sent4: The hacker scammed access to confidential information.
meanings.sent5: The street performer scammed tourists with his sleight of hand tricks.
